intro: Saprosma kraussii, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 10,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically small, tubular, and brightly colored, often in shades of yellow or orange. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
